page.title: 11UPPER CALDECOTE, BEDS.
page.content: The word Caldecote means literally 'cold cottages' and results from the exposed situation of the village. Upper Caldecote is basically a linear village along its two main roads, but the ancient green still survives. There are about 1600 villagers. There is no industry, but there are many thriving agricultural & horticultural businesses concerned with both the growing & selling of produce. There are 3 general shops, including a Post Office/Stores, a hairdresser, florist, & several farm shops. The Church and Chapel, the modern VC lower school & the 2 public houses are all in the central part of the village. Housing is divided fairly equally between older terraced & villa type homes, & modern houses built in the last 20-30 years. There are no architectural features of outstanding merit.
